gui

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.GUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, java.lang.Runnable, java.awt.event.WindowListener
    This GUI is used, to look the Header and Images of Dicoms, to Search and Sort Dicoms and to convert Dicoms to Niftis.
    Author:
    Dominik Ridder
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • DEBUG

        public static final boolean DEBUG
        Boolean Value that can be used for Test's. Note that conditions like if (DEBUG) {...} can be optimised by the compiler in that way, that there is no if condition at this place.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • testnewsize

        @Deprecated
public static boolean testnewsize
        Deprecated. 
        Temporary boolean that was used, to test a new size System on other Operating Systems. In case that this new way of sizing would have caused problems, it could be dissabled quickly and easy with this boolean. Nevertheless this boolean should be removed in future.

      • RIGHT_CLICK

        public static final int RIGHT_CLICK
        Int value that represents the right click Button on the Mouse.

        This boolean is true, if the underlying System is a linux based OS.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI(boolean forceProgrammEndIfThereIsNoWindow,
           boolean visible)
        Constructs a new GUI. The GUI can be controlled with a Mouse or even based on Java code.
        Parameters:
        forceProgrammEndIfThereIsNoWindow - determines, if System.exit(1) is called, if all windows closed
        visible - Is used to control the visibility of the GUI. This can be helpfull for testcases.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] agrs)
        Main method, to start the GUI.
        Parameters:
        agrs - This value is currently ignored.

      • run

        public void run()
        Method, which is called by new Threads, to make life updates in the tabs. Each ImageExtractor Window has his own Thread this way.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getStatusLabel

        public javax.swing.JLabel getStatusLabel()
        Getter for the StatusLabel. The StatusLabel can be used to print any text information at the Bottom of the Gui into the Statusbar.
        Returns:
        The StatusLabel of the Gui.

      • getProgressBar

        public javax.swing.JProgressBar getProgressBar()
        Getter for the ProgressBar. The Progressbar can be use to display the progress of a Task in the Statusbar.
        Returns:
        The ProgressBar of the Gui.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Method, to find, if the GUI is running.
        Returns:
        true, if there are more than 0 window open; else false

      • setCurrentTab

        public void setCurrentTab(int i)
        Setting the current displayed Tab of the GUI.
        Parameters:
        i - The Position of the tab in the Tabbar.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        This Method is called by the JMenuBar and the Buttons inside of the VolumeTab.

        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • setExtendedWindow

        @Deprecated
public void setExtendedWindow(boolean bool)
        Deprecated. 
        This Method was used, to change the Size of the GUI. This was used by the Sorter and VolumeTab, since the ROI Panel took additional space.
        Parameters:
        bool - if true, expanding the window; else making it smaller

      • requestWidth

        public void requestWidth(int width,
                         MyTab requester)
        Requesting a new Width Size for the GUI. This Method only works, if the Tab, that calls this Method, is the current focused Tab.
        Parameters:
        width - The new Width for the GUI.
        requester - The 'MyTab' that calls this method.

      • setfinalSize

        Secures, that a Component should stay in his Shape.
        Parameters:
        p - The Component, that gets modified
        d - The Dimension, the Component should fit

      • addComponents

        public static void addComponents(javax.swing.JPanel here,
                                 java.awt.Component[] toadd)
        Method to add a list of Components to a JPanel. This Method can be used, to create shorter code.
        Parameters:
        here - The JPanel, that should contain the Components at the end
        toadd - The Components, that are added to the JPanel

      • stateChanged

        public void stateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent e)
        This Method detects changes in the Tabbar. The Method onExit() gets called on the old Tab, if there was a old tab. Also the Method onFocus() is called at the new Tab.
        Specified by:
        stateChanged in interface javax.swing.event.ChangeListener

      • getCurrentTab

        public MyTab getCurrentTab()
        This Method returns the current Tab.
        Returns:

      • windowClosing

        public void windowClosing(java.awt.event.WindowEvent e)
        This Method is used, to keep the number of Windows up to date. If all windows are closed and GUI constructur was called with GUI(true, x), than System.exit(1) is executed to make sure that this thread terminates.
        Specified by:
        windowClosing in interface java.awt.event.WindowListener
